thread.title: NYC college getting $10.7M grant to train for health jobs
thread.title_full: NYC college getting $10.7M grant to train for health jobs - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: NYC college getting $10.7M grant to train for health jobs
text:
NEW YORK (AP) - A community college in the Bronx is getting a $10.7 million federal grant to train students for health-care jobs such as certified nurse assistant and patient care technician.
Hostos (OH'-stohs) Community College announced the five-year grant from the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services on Friday.
It is the largest grant in the 47-year history of the college.
The funds will pay for low-income New Yorkers to be trained for in-demand health-care jobs.
Participants will receive job-placement services. College counseling will also be available if they wish to pursue a degree at a four-year college.
Carlos Molina, the college's vice president of continuing education and workforce development, said the grant will help needy New Yorkers achieve upward mobility.
Hostos is part of the City University of New York system.
